landing.description1: The online tool for submitting and resolving your BC Violation Ticket disputes.
landing.description2: If you would like to simply pay for your ticket, please click on the 'Pay Now' button.

step_1.heading: Initiate Dispute
step_1.detail: Login using your BC Services card and initiate the online dispute process.

step_2.heading: Violation Ticket Lookup
step_2.detail: Find your Violation Ticket and ensure that the specifics of the ticket are correct. Through our step-by-step process, you can indicate your preferences and how you would like the ticket to be disputed.

step_3.heading: Violation Ticket Dispute
step_3.detail: Submit your dispute or save the details until you are ready to proceed with the dispute process. You have 365 days to dispute your ticket from the date the ticket was issued.

self_resolution.heading: Self Dispute Wizard
self_resolution.detail: Interact with an online wizard and explore reasons behind your ticket. The online wizard will take you through multiple options demonstrated through text, videos and images.

find.heading: Find Your BC Traffic Ticket
find.note_forms: Forms are available on the website at
find.sub_heading: Enter the Violation Ticket Number and the Violation Time to find your ticket.

disputant.note: A notice of hearing will be mailed to the above address. You MUST notify the Violation Ticket Centre of any new address of change of address in writing.

count.agree_offence_committed: I agree I committed this offence(s) and would like to request a fine reduction and/or time to pay by supplying written reasons to the court for review.
count.did_you_know_desc: You can have your dispute heard by the court in person, or if you agree you committed the offence, you may supply written reasons requesting a fine reduction and/or time to pay without having to attend a court hearing. You can choose to use the written reasons option up to 5 business days before your hearing date.

additional.description: The following additional information is requested and may be changed at any time. This information is used to schedule enough time for the court hearing and changes to the information may cause delays.
additional.heading: Additional Information
additional.interpreter_required: I require a language interpreter at the hearing.
additional.interpreter_language_desc: If you don’t see your language listed, please contact your nearest court registry.
additional.lawyer_note: If you want a lawyer to represent you at your hearing, it is recommended that you consult with them as soon as possible so they can ensure their availability for a hearing date and provide you with advice.
additional.no_lawyer: I do NOT intend to be represented at the hearing by a lawyer
additional.no_interpreter: I do NOT require a speaking interpreter at the hearing
additional.no_witness: I do NOT intend to call a witness
additional.note: If the disputant or the disputant’s agent does not attend the court hearing, the court will treat the violation ticket as not disputed, the conviction(s) to the allegation(s) will be recorded against the record of the disputant, and the prescribed ticketed amount(s) will become immediately due and payable.
additional.represented_by_lawyer: I intend to be represented by a lawyer or agent in court.
additional.requests: Please indicate if the following apply
additional.sub_heading: The following questions apply to ALL counts on this ticket that are currently under dispute. If any of these are required for any count in the dispute, please select them.
additional.witness: I intend to call a witness
additional.witness_note1: If you are calling witnesses please keep the following information in mind:
additional.witness_note2: You are responsible for ensuring they are aware of the hearing date. If necessary, you may change the number of witnesses who attend the court hearing.
